John,

Without a signature to give me a pointer, it is a
daunting prospect to go through the volumes of the
Haynes Index and try to match up your gold seal.
    Someone more knowledgable may be able to recommend
a more efficient method.

As to the red lacquer attribution, I cannot see it
well enough to read. I will try an opinion later today
after work. Maybe some people will follow suit.

Curran



--- Dr John P Lissenden <docliss@...>
wrote:
> 
> A colleage, and collector, has recently purchased
> the sukashi tsuba 
> illustrated in my Photo Album JPL and has asked for
> my advice 
> regarding its possible attribution and for a
> translation of the red 
> lacquer inscription  The figure on the bottom left
> appears to be a 
> kao, but I am otherwise at a complete loss.  Any
> help/suggestions re 
> either of these requests would be much appreciated.
> 
> While you are in my Photo Album, I am still seeking
> some information 
> on the gold, hira-zogan seal.  There has been a
> complete absence of 
> replies to my earlier request regarding this.
> 
> Grateful thanks and regards, JPL.
